Maternal Deaths 
A maternal death is defined by WHO as the 
death of a woman while pregnant or within 42 
days of the termination of pregnancy, irrespective 
of the duration or site of the pregnancy, for 
any cause related to or aggravated by the 
pregnancy or its management, but not from 
accidental or incidental causes. Maternal deaths 
can be due to direct or indirect obstetric causes 
of death
